meta_title: Orfina Porsche Design Military Chronograph Ref. 7177 – Flying Tigers Dial Variant
meta_description: Explore the Orfina Porsche Design Military Chronograph Ref. 7177 ‘Flying Tigers’ dial variant featuring matte black dial, red 3H tritium markers, US Air Force 23rd Tactical Fighter Group association, and powered by the rugged Lemania 5100 movement. An iconic black PVD military chronograph.
meta_keywords: Orfina Porsche Design 7177 Flying Tigers dial, Military Chronograph USAF 23rd Tactical Fighter Group, Porsche Design black dial, Lemania 5100 chronograph, 3H luminous military dial, PVD watch case, 1980s military watch, US Air Force chronograph

text:
The Flying Tiger Watches were Issued for the U.S. Air Force’s 23rd
Tactical Fighter Group.

The 23rd Fighter Group is the home of the Air Force's legendary Flying
Tigers and is stationed at Moody Air Force Base. The 23rd Fighter
Group's primary mission is forward air control, close-air support,
interdiction, and combat search and rescue operations.

The 23rd Fighter Group traces its roots back to the 23rd Pursuit Group,
which was formed on December 17, 1941, just 10 days after the
Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor. The group had three squadrons
assigned to carry out their mission: the 74th, 75th, and 76th Fighter
Squadrons.

A particularly interesting note is that the aircraft assigned to the group has
the unique "Shark Teeth" nose art. The Flying Tigers are the only Air
Force unit authorized to carry this distinctive and historical aircraft
marking.
The Flying Tiger watches were produced in two batches:

list.title: Mk. 1 Flying Tiger Dial:
list.text:
Featuring both the “U.S. Air Force”
inscription and the Flying Tiger logo.

list.title: Mk. 2 Flying Tiger Dial:
list.text:
Retaining the Flying Tiger logo but omitting
the “U.S. Air Force” inscription.

The casebacks of both variants were identical to those of the baseline
7177. Most examples were finished in Silver/Sablé, Black PVD, or NTS
PVD.
